data.title: `wordPattern` not supported in language-configuration.json
data.body: It appears that `wordPattern` is only supported by programmatically setting the language configuration in an extension and not in a `language-configuration.json` specified in `package.json`

data.title: Create Helllo World
data.body: This is just a test.

data.title: Integrated Terminal can be a fantastic console emulator for Windows
data.body:
I think integrated terminal is the most good-looking console emulator for Windows, but I have to open VS Code to use it. So, what about devloping an independent console emulator based on VS Code Integrated Terminal for Windows users? You know, Windows users need a powerful terminal (cmder has more functions but doesn't look good as Integrated Terminal).

I hope it can be:
1. VS Code style
2. As functional as cmder (more is better)
3. Well cooperate with cmd, powershell, bash on windows
4. Implement some features like zsh

Please consider my suggestion, thanks.

data.title: The padding of markdown preview is broken when zooming up
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home 64bit build 14393.321

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any Markdown file
2. Open Markdown preview (`Ctrl + Shift + V`)
3. Zoom up (`Ctrl + ;`)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7354350/19624613/cca22ccc-9939-11e6-928f-2b5d8a911897.png)

Notes:
- The problem occurs only when zooming _up_, not zooming _down_.

data.title: Copy ´patse command line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Paste something into integrated terminal by ctrl+v

---

Windows 10 has ctrl+c, ctrl+v support in command line. In VS code ctrl+v will enter ^V

data.title: wrong comment show 显示错误的注释
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:

1.when in html file , i comment javascript file , 
   it show : <--let bao = 1;-->,  not show  // let bao = 1;or /_let bao = 1_/
   css it show : <--color: red-->, not show  // color: red; or /_color: red_/
2.在html文件里面的script标签里面写js, 和 style标签里面写 css, 如果用快捷键注释它, 都会显示错误的注释方式
   不是显示正确的js注释, 而是在js中, 把js语法当作html语法 , 显示html注释

data.title: VSCode hangs produces error when opening
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.61
- OS Version: Windows Server 2012 R2

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right click vscode run as administrator
2. Takes 2 minutes to open
3. Click on src folder just shows busy indicator and unresponsive
4. Finally get error message ERROR: read ECONNRESET

Task manager shows VSCode processes one is taking over 90% CPU
VSCode unusable.
No extensions installed.

BTW it never worked even just after the installation.

Can anybody tell me what I'm doing wrong?

data.title: Scroll multiple editors together
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create two editors, one in the left side and one in the right side.
2. When editing a file comparing with another file, I want to scoll both two editors in the same time .

data.title: Git push hangs when authentication fails
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: OS X Yosemite 10.10.5

When I try to push to a repo I am not authorised to, the git wheel keeps spinning and a reason is not output.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set up two-factor authentication on your github account, for a remote you are using https to connect to
2. Try to push a commit

Can get around this by fixing authentication issue, which can be discovered using the git CLI.

data.title: Unexpected tab completion
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: OS X

I've recently added the issue regarding unexpected tab completion https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/13141

That issue is closed but still not fixed. Current behavior turns me into frustration, I suggest you to make notes on that issue (I still believe it should be fixed) and give some comments.

Thanks.

  - [x] g++

data.title: [Feature Request] View the TMLanguage scope that is called in the editor.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This is a feature that is supported in Sublime Text that allows the user to see the scope that is called with (ctrl - shift - alt - P). I find this feature useful because I need to write TMLanguage files to support SKON (a new object notation language) syntax highlighting and error highlighting in VSCode.

I do not know how difficult such an implementation would be, but if it is easy it would be a definite quality of life improvement. If is is a big job, it most likely is not worth the effort

data.title: Right-click to Copy selection and Paste on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: 10.0.14393

In the native terminal, right-click pastes from the clipboard, or right-click on selection copies to clipboard. In the integrated terminal, the context menu is displayed to copy and paste, like in previous versions of Windows.

Please update the integrated terminal to use the native behaviour. This change in behaviour is the single greatest usability enhancement that Microsoft has done to the native terminal, bringing it in line with other OS's.

data.title: Why is cwd always set to application folder on Windows?
data.body:
I'm curious why this is done,, as it's what caused https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/11735 

The change: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/b43c9501474806a11d0d73a26d27759c1401a8ad#diff-1c90ff38a08209f9ebd4d05d1e43358eR102

data.title: Hot Exit: Support hot exit on folder workspaces
data.body: The initial implementation of hot exit (#101) will work on workspaces with folders when closing single windows only.

data.title: Remove unnecessary call to registry at workbench startup
when chinese in the file path, openning the integrated console error
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  open a folder, there is chinese in the folder path
2. open the integraded console, the system alert a error message.

data.title: Multicursor intellisense only shows up on the first instance
data.body:
Have some code like

``` javascript
let a = "";
a.


a.
```

Except imagine that the two `a`s are more than a page apart. From the first one, use cmd+d to add a second cursor to the second. It scrolls to bring the second in view. Now if you press ctrl+space, you get the intellisense popup on the first one, which is off screen, so you don't see it.

data.title: Lamp icon is not clickable at the first hover
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0-insider
- OS Version: macOS Sierra (10.12)

In the new insiders when these lamp icons appears the first time that you hover on them they disappear for the break point to be placed and in the second time you try to click on them they let you do so. This is a bit too not user-friendly:

![icon](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2157285/19615092/e266d450-9807-11e6-8fa8-0618d92a2f2f.gif)

data.title: SyntaxError: Unexpected token '...'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Straight from master
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. git clone http://github.com/Microsoft/vscode
2. cd vscode
3. gulp (unless you don't have gulp installed, npm install -g gulp is 3rd and this is 4th)
